title: Drawing, "Design for a Mantelpiece in the Villa Albani", 1755–57
medium: Pen, brown ink, brown and gray wash, graphite on cream laid paper
markings:
Marks: Tracing mounted beneath drawing- shows a decorated shield (with crown ornamantation on top) enclosing the Strasburg lily. Underneath are the letters "VDL".
Stamps: To the left of the fireplace (in black ink): Museum for the Arts of Decoration, Cooper Union [Lugt 457c]
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: An ornate mantelpiece, decorated with sculpted reliefs of lion heads and scrolls occupies the center of the design. A carved frame, supported by pilasters and ornamented with garlands, rosettes, and griffins terminates in a triangular pediment. The overmantel contains an antique bust of Antinous. Flanking the mantelpiece are two men - on the right a man of humble origins accompanied by a dog crouches, holding wooden planks. On the left, a well dressed man stands and watches, holding a walking stick.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Mantelpiece in the Villa Albani", 1755–57.
1755–57. Pen, brown ink, brown and gray wash, graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1326.
